data.directionsInfo: Located off ME 3 in Hulls Cove (just north of Bar Harbor) Hulls Cove Visitor Center is at the top of the hill above the large parking lots. An accessible entrance is also available.
data.name: Hulls Cove Visitor Center

operatingHours.description: The visitor center operates seasonally and is closed November 1 through April 30 every year.
operatingHours.name: Hulls Cove Visitor Center

data.description:
Hulls Cove Visitor Center is the perfect place to begin your Acadia National Park visit. Here you can find park passes and park rangers to answer your questions. Large, self-service maps and digital information screens help you plan your visit. You can also purchase items from the Acadia National Park Store.

Since its construction in the 60's, visitors have taken their first 'hike' in Acadia up the center's 52 steps.  Follow the signs for accessible access. The visitor center operates seasonally.

data.directionsInfo: Located near the Village Green in Bar Harbor, the visitor center is on Firefly Lane.
data.name: Village Green Information Center

operatingHours.description: Village Green Information Center is located in downtown Bar Harbor, Maine.
operatingHours.name: Village Green Information Center

data.description: Information,  Island Explorer buses, and park passes.

data.directionsInfo: Accessible only by boat, Islesford Historical Museum is located to the left of the Town Pier in Islesford.
data.name: Islesford Historical Museum

operatingHours.description: The Islesford Historical Museum will be closed to the public for the 2020 season to complete a major rehabilitation which began in November. The museum is expected to reopen in 2021 showcasing both the upgrades and a community-curated exhibit helping to tell the stories of the Cranberry Isles.
operatingHours.name: Islesford Historical Museum

data.description: The Islesford Historical Museum will be closed to the public for the 2020 season to complete a major rehabilitation which began in November. The museum is expected to reopen in 2021 showcasing both the upgrades and a community-curated exhibit helping to tell the stories of the Cranberry Isles.

data.directionsInfo: Sieur de Monts Nature Center can be accessed from Park Loop Road as well as ME 3 (Main Street) south of Bar Harbor. Follow park signs.
data.name: Sieur de Monts Nature Center

operatingHours.description: Sieur de Monts Nature Center is open daily 9 am to 5 pm, May 2 through Oct 14, 2019.
operatingHours.name: Sieur de Monts Nature Center

data.description: Exhibits, information, hiking information, and Wild Gardens.

data.directionsInfo: Rockefeller Welcome Center is located in the Schoodic District of Acadia. Follow ME 186 into Winter Harbor, and follow signs for the Schoodic Education and Research Center. Take Schoodic Loop Road to Arey Cove Drive, and take your first right onto Acadia Drive. Take your second left onto Atterbury Circle to park in the small parking lot.
data.name: Rockefeller Welcome Center

operatingHours.description:
From Memorial Day through Columbus Day: Rockefeller Hall exhibits and Welcome Center are open seven days per week.

From Columbus Day to Memorial Day: Rockefeller Hall exhibits and Welcome Center are open Mon-Fri, 10 am- 4 pm and Administration hours at Rockefeller Hall are Mon-Fri from 8 am - 4 pm.
operatingHours.name: Rockefeller Welcome Center

data.description: Exhibits about old Navy base and information.

phoneNumbers.description: General information. Answered during the summer season. In winter, call 207-288-3338.

emailAddresses.description: General inquiries and all park questions.

data.directionsInfo: Located on the Schoodic Peninsula, this campground is 3 miles (5 km) southeast of Winter Harbor. Access to the campground is from Schoodic Loop Drive off ME 186.
data.name: Schoodic Woods Campground Ranger Station

operatingHours.description: Schoodic Woods Campground Ranger Station is open from the Wednesday before Memorial Day until Columbus Day.
operatingHours.name: Schoodic Woods Campground Ranger Station

data.description: Information, Camping, Island Explorer buses, and park passes.

data.name: Winter Operations with Bar Harbor Chamber of Commerce

operatingHours.description: There are currently no in-person visitor services available while the Bar Harbor Chamber of Commerce Visitor Center, 2 Cottage St., Bar Harbor, remains closed in response to coronavirus (COVID-19).
operatingHours.name: Winter Operations with Bar Harbor Chamber of Commerce

data.description: The park provides information services for visitors at the Bar Harbor Chamber of Commerce, 2 Cottage Street, at the corner of Cottage and Main streets.
